p: The selectivity index (SI) for LEO extracted in 2013 and 2015 and LSEO 2013 were 4.86, 4.15 and 4.29, respectively, showing that they were less toxic on CHO cells than Leishmania parasites. However, in all cases, they are lower than 10, the minimum value defined for the selection of an anti-parasitic hit [ 31, 32]. Thus these oils could perhaps be used safely at therapeutic concentration in short term treatments but R- (+)-limonene (SI=1.79) cannot be considered as a drug candidate for the development of anti-leishmanial agents.
